dropCapOptions.stacked: Letter on colored background (dcapCol = bg, dcapseCol = text)
dropCapOptions.framed: Letter with colored border (dcapCol = text & border, dcapseCol = bg)

warnings: dropCap: true required to enable drop cap
dcapView determines style: default, stacked, or framed
For stacked: dcapCol = background, dcapseCol = text color
For framed: dcapCol = text & border color, dcapseCol = background
tcapSize adds padding around letter
tcapspac sets right margin (space before text)
Drop caps work best with paragraph text, not single lines

attributes.title: The State of Modern Web Development
attributes.content: The landscape of web development has evolved dramatically over the past decade. What once required extensive coding knowledge and manual optimization can now be accomplished with intuitive tools and frameworks. Modern developers have access to powerful libraries, cloud infrastructure, and collaborative platforms that streamline the entire development process. Yet with these advances come new challenges: keeping up with rapidly changing technologies, managing increasing complexity, and ensuring accessibility and performance across diverse devices and browsers. The successful developer of today must balance technical expertise with user experience design, security awareness, and business acumen.

examples.responsiveNotes: 3 columns desktop → 2 columns tablet → 1 column mobile. Column gaps scale down responsively.
warnings: Requires sufficient content length for multi-column to look good
Test column breaks - orphaned words/lines can occur
Justified alignment works best with multi-column layouts
Very short content looks awkward in multiple columns

descTag.description: HTML tag for content. Use 'div' when content contains lists or complex HTML

pCol.description: Number of columns for CSS multi-column layout. '1' = single column, '2' = 2 columns, etc.

dcapView.description: Drop cap style: default (plain), stacked (background), framed (border)

warnings: **CRITICAL**: Never modify block_id after creation
Showtitle: true required to display title and use titleTypo, titleColor, titleBtmSpace
descTag: 'p' works for plain text, use 'div' for HTML lists or complex content
pCol uses CSS columns - may not work in IE11 and older browsers
dropCap only affects first letter of first paragraph in content
For stacked drop caps: dcapCol = background color, dcapseCol = text color
For framed drop caps: dcapCol = text & border color, dcapseCol = background color
textTypo requires openTypography: 1 to apply font settings
ulMargin/ulPadding only affect <ul> and <ol> elements in content
Multi-column layouts work best with longer content (3+ paragraphs)
Test multi-column column breaks with actual content to avoid orphans/widows

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting title colors/typography without Showtitle: true
commonMistakes.fix: Set Showtitle: true to enable title display

commonMistakes.mistake: Using descTag: 'p' with HTML lists in content
commonMistakes.fix: Change descTag to 'div' when content contains <ul>/<ol> or complex HTML
commonMistakes.impact: Invalid HTML nesting, potential rendering issues

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting openTypography: 0 then expecting typography to apply
commonMistakes.fix: Set openTypography: 1 in textTypo or titleTypo objects

commonMistakes.mistake: Using too many columns with short content
commonMistakes.fix: Use 2-3 columns max, and ensure sufficient content length

commonMistakes.mistake: Swapping dcapCol and dcapseCol for stacked drop caps
commonMistakes.fix: Remember: stacked uses dcapCol for background, dcapseCol for text
Always set pCol for md, sm, xs breakpoints
commonMistakes.impact: Too many columns on mobile, poor readability

bestPractices: Use titleBtmSpace to create breathing room between title and content (15-25px)
Set responsive pCol values: desktop (2-3 columns) → tablet (1-2) → mobile (1)
Use pcolspac between 30-50px for clear column separation
Drop caps work best with at least 2-3 paragraphs of content
Use justified alignment (alignment: 'justify') for multi-column layouts
Keep link colors consistent with brand (linkColor, linkHoverColor)
Use text shadows sparingly - subtle is better (blur: 2-4, low opacity)
For lists, use ulMargin/ulPadding to control spacing instead of inline styles
Test drop cap sizing - 50-70px fontSize typically works well
Use descTag: 'div' for complex HTML content, 'p' for plain text
performanceNotes: Multi-column CSS is performant - minimal impact
Text shadows can impact text rendering performance - use sparingly
Long content with many columns may cause layout recalculation on resize

semanticHTML: Use appropriate titleTag (h1-h6) for document outline
Use descTag: 'p' for paragraphs, 'div' for complex content
Ensure logical heading hierarchy (don't skip levels)
colorContrast: Ensure textColor meets WCAG AA (4.5:1 for normal text)
Drop cap colors must also meet contrast requirements
